item.title: Why wont this work!
item.dc:creator: @Volrom Volrom
item.description:
@Volrom wrote:

Ok, listen, here’s what I think: You have no logical vairables (An old method of Java):

{
  client person = (client)p;
 if(p != null && person != null) 
{
   if(p != null && person != null)
{ 
     if (person.distanceToPoint(npcs[i].absX, npcs[i].absY) >= 5)
     if (npcs[i].npcType != 1158 || npcs[i].npcType == 2745 || npcs[i].npcType == 2597 || npcs[i].npcType == 2740 || npcs[i].npcType == 2591 || npcs[i].npcType == 2598 || npcs[i].npcType == 2610 || npcs[i].npcType == 2627 || npcs[i].npcType == 2631 || npcs[i].npcType == 2605)
{

What you have to do is declare a logical variable such as:

if (playerLevel[3] = 100) {
then (npcs[i].npcType == 2029); 
}
else if (playerLevel[3] <= 45) {
then (npcs[i].npcType == 114);
}

Meaning, that if a player has 45 hp, then a less agressive npc will be spawned, and if player has, say 100 hp, then a super agressive npc will be spawned.
This code is not a 100% accurate, just a heads up so you don’t get frusterated when it says ERROR–>. Just wanted to give you a starting code, gonna work on this and post back if i finish =).

-Volrom

Read full topic
